muse_editorials.dek: Highways 40, 20, and 49 as living routes: First Peoples, gold, art, and small-town mythologies stitched into the Sierra.

lead_quote.text: Nevada County's highways are more than just roads—they are cultural corridors.

muse_editorials.author: Jesse Locks

muse_editorials.title: Off the Wall: Art in Nature
muse_editorials.dek: Temporary trail art that asks you to slow down and notice: installations, land stewardship, and the outdoor gallery as a local tradition.

lead_quote.text: Designed to be temporary, the works invite trail users to pause and appreciate the natural beauty before them.

muse_editorials.author: Annette Muller

muse_editorials.title: Be Many and Be Loud
muse_editorials.dek: Open mics as the county's literary on-ramp: a place to practice craft, meet collaborators, and build a culture of listening.

lead_quote.text: We're watching a shift from something solitary to something communal that people really need.

muse_editorials.author: Karen Terrey

muse_editorials.title: Rural Is the New Cool
muse_editorials.dek: A local's drive: Tyler Foote Road, the Ridge, and downtown Nevada City rituals that feel like they’ve always existed.

lead_quote.text: Drive north on Highway 49 from Nevada City... and you will feel time slow down.

muse_editorials.author: Diana Arbex

muse_editorials.title: Architect Julia Morgan's Legacy in Nevada County
muse_editorials.dek: A design lineage that refuses to dominate the landscape: craft, material honesty, and buildings that feel like conversations with place.

lead_quote.text: Both the North Star House and the Twin Pines Lake & Ski House could have been monuments to dominance over nature; instead, they are conversations with nature that celebrate their surroundings.

muse_editorials.author: Kyle Winters

muse_editorials.title: Latinx Culture: At Home in the Moment
muse_editorials.dek: Year-round visibility through food, music, festivals, and the daily stages created by schools, nonprofits, and small businesses.

lead_quote.text: These events aren't simply entertainment, but vital anchors of identity, belonging, and connection.

muse_editorials.author: Leslie Caratachea
